results.title: Exploring futures
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
This program raises many questions, among them: How might futures compare with the past and present? To what extent can we shape our futures? Is all change necessarily progress? What are some factors supporting and constraining our influence on futures? What kind of future would you prefer? What range of choices are open to individuals groups and governments? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Presented by Annette Shun Wah. This video is divided into five themes: ATTITUDES TO WORK; CHOICES IN THE PAST; CHOICES TODAY; ISSUES IN THE WORKPLACE; THE CHANGING NATURE OF WORK.

results.title: Arts in society
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A program in which archival footage has been selected to provide students with some background on the influence of the arts in Australians’ lives.

results.title: Beliefs, values and customs
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Jan Punch and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
In order to cover some of the great diversity of Australian life over the years, 12 one-hour titles have been produced. “Beliefs, Values and Customs” is Part One of the two-part Cultural Environment and examines Aboriginal culture, the religions of Australia, the British heritage, a multicultural society , the influences of the mass media and advertising the Aussie image, sport, language and communication.

results.title: Political power
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
There are four themes providing some answers to important questions. Who holds power in Australia? How is it distributed? What conflicts arise through the unequal distribution of power? How is it resolved? What means do Australians have to influence the decision making process? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Rights and responsibilities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
This program is one of two dealing with politics in Australia during the course of this century. In “Rights and Responsibilities” the film segments have been selected to help students understand the Australian political process. Arranged in four themes, the program illustrates all levels in the political process. There are individuals fighting for their rights, pressure groups, society’s institutions, three levels of government, the monarchy and international relations.. Presented by Annette Shun Wah

results.title: Living together
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Dealing with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Each program is made up of short sequences from films and videos stored in the archives of Film Australia. This program looks at the individual and society, discrimination, resolving differences between individuals and groups in our society, working together in groups for a variety of purposes and society in change. Presented by Annette Shun Wah

results.title: Learning about life
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Dealing with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Each program is made up of short sequences from films and videos stored in the archives of Film Australia. In this, the second of three programs dealing with Australia’s social environment, the underlying theme relates to socialisation, rites of passage, celebrations, the family, childhood training, formal education, peer group influences, informal education and learning throughout life. Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Women in change
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A history of Australia’s women looking specifically at: the suffragette movement; the campaign for equal pay; women and unionism; abortion; contraception, sexual harassment; and politics.

results.title: Using the land
results.creator_credit: Judith Adamson, Jan Punch and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Six themes: OWNING THE LAND, CHANGING THE LAND, FARMING THE LAND, MINING THE LAND, SETTLING THE LAND and APPRECIATING THE LAND. ‘USING THE LAND’ helps to provide answers to four major questions: What is the importance of the land to Australians? How have Australians used the land over time? What are the effects of its usage? What needs to be done to protect and conserve the environment as a sustainable resource for the future? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.
